data.text: @APjdhanna We know a body of literature supports mask effectiveness. A more intelligent discussion is “when are they no longer worth it?”  Published today: https://t.co/xDMcKOAebF
@APjdhanna Guess it’s a right to die bill.

@APjdhanna @KCMikeMahoney It looks like they’re opening the state up to more litigation. As in we can file suit for either situation! And continue it!

So us tax payers are the hook to defend both sides.  Follow the money to find out why!

@APjdhanna @ethancorson Irresponsible and disgraceful. If you're an elected official you'd think you'd feel responsibility to have the correct facts when making such decisions on behalf of constituents. It's literally their job to look at accurate facts in order to serve the best interests of the public
@APjdhanna Love how Republicans have become “for centralized government.”
@APjdhanna Banning masks? So I could be fined or worse for wearing a mask in public? Do they know rhe pandemic is not over yet? #BA2variant is coming.
@APjdhanna Not important to say they campaign on local control?

@APjdhanna I am old enough to remember when Republicans respected the Tenth Amendment, even the Amendment's Police Powers which give state government authority to protect the health, safety, and morals of the people.
